Edition name: Digitale Edition der Handschrift Cod. Guelf. 64 Weiss.
Content Description: A digital facsimile and transcription of the Weissenburg manuscript, a significant 8th-century collection of catechetical texts, creeds, and glossaries.
A comprehensive archive of the 18th-century poet's complete poems, selected prose, and correspondence, including his famous "Elegy Written in a Country Churchyard."

Edition name: A critical edition of the poetry of Dafydd ap Gwilym
Content Description: A scholarly collection of the complete works of the 14th-century Welsh bard, known for his innovative nature poetry and love lyrics.
The autobiographical writings of Ireland's patron saint, detailing his captivity, escape, and missionary work, presented in Latin with translations.

Edition name: Liber Matriculae - Il libro della matricola dei notai di Vercelli
Content Description: A digital edition of the register of notaries from Vercelli, offering insights into medieval Italian legal administration and professional organization.
The extensive correspondence of the French philosopher, covering theological debates, literary criticism, and the circulation of ideas in the Republic of Letters.
Thin wood tablets serving as the oldest surviving handwritten documents in Britain, revealing details of Roman military life and administration.
A continuation of the project digitizing further discoveries of wooden tablets from the Vindolanda fort, expanding the corpus of Roman military correspondence.

Edition name: Bérardier de Bataut, Essai sur le récit, Entretiens sur la manière de raconter
Content Description: A critical edition of an 18th-century treatise on the art of storytelling and narrative theory, exploring the mechanics of oral and written recitals.
One of the oldest and most important biblical manuscripts, containing the Greek Old Testament (Septuagint) and the complete New Testament.

Edition name: The Saint-Aubins "Book of Arses": The Livre de Caricatures tant bonnes que mauvaises
Content Description: A digitized sketchbook by the 18th-century artist featuring satirical and humorous caricatures, offering a rare glimpse into the irreverent side of Rococo art.
A critical repertory of conjectures on the text of Catullus's poems, compiling scholarly emendations and textual variants from the Renaissance to the present.

Edition name: Digital edition of the Old Church Slavonic Codex Suprasliensis
Content Description: A digital reunification of the 10th-century Codex Suprasliensis, the largest surviving Old Church Slavonic manuscript, containing saints' lives and homilies.

Edition name: Becerro Galicano of San Millán de la Cogolla
Content Description: A digital edition of the cartulary from the San Millán monastery, a crucial source for medieval Spanish history, linguistics, and paleography.
A comprehensive edition of the "Book of Life" from Durham Cathedral, listing the names of thousands of benefactors and community members from the 9th to the 16th century.
A genetic edition of Beckett's works, presenting digital facsimiles and transcriptions of his manuscripts to trace the evolution of his texts.
An edition of the ancient and medieval marginal commentaries (scholia) on the plays of Euripides, providing essential context for the interpretation of Greek tragedy.
A collection of sagas about the Norwegian kings, written in Old Norse, blending history, genealogy, and legend.
An electronic edition of the 12th-century Old French romance Partonopeus de Blois, a hybrid of Arthurian legend and classical mythology.
A calendar and edition of the Fine Rolls of Henry III, recording payments made to the King for concessions and offering detailed insights into 13th-century governance.
The collected correspondence of the famous Bernoulli family of mathematicians, documenting the development of calculus and physics in the 17th and 18th centuries.
A digital text of Goldoni's comedy about an obsessive collector, highlighting the conflict between old-world obsession and practical family life.

Edition name: Die Glossen Ekkeharts IV. im Codex Sangallensis 621
Content Description: An edition of the interlinear and marginal glosses by Ekkehard IV on the text of Orosius, serving as a key source for medieval education and Latinity.

Edition name: Inscriptions of the Northern Black Sea (IOSPE)
Content Description: A corpus of ancient Greek and Latin inscriptions found on the northern coast of the Black Sea, documenting the history of the Bosporan Kingdom and Greek colonies.
A multimedia edition of Cervantes' play La Entretenida, featuring the text alongside performance materials and scholarly commentary.

Edition name: A Survey of the Cities of London and Westminster by John Strype
Content Description: A digital version of Strype's 1720 update to Stow's survey, providing a detailed topographical and historical description of early 18th-century London.
The correspondence of an Elizabethan intelligencer and diplomat, offering a behind-the-scenes look at 16th-century espionage and politics.

Edition name: The Diplomatic Correspondence of Thomas Bodley
Content Description: The letters of the founder of the Bodleian Library during his time as Queen Elizabeth's ambassador to the Netherlands.
A transcription of the recently discovered folio of Robert Hooke, containing minutes of the Royal Society and personal scientific notes.
A digital edition of the laboratory notebooks and workdiaries of the father of modern chemistry, documenting his experiments and thought processes.
An archive containing transcriptions and facsimiles of Swift's major prose works, including Gulliver's Travels and A Tale of a Tub.
A database of the thousands of Old Irish glosses found in the St. Gall manuscript of Priscian's Latin grammar, a crucial source for Celtic philology.
A comprehensive digital archive of Nietzsche's complete works, posthumous fragments, and correspondence, based on the critical Colli-Montinari edition.
A searchable database of medieval Irish glossaries (Sanas Cormaic, O'Mulconry's Glossary), which explain difficult or archaic words in early Irish literature.
A parallel text edition of the 1577 and 1587 editions of Holinshed's Chronicles, the primary source for many of Shakespeare's history plays.
A comparative edition of the various printings of Alciato's Emblematum Liber, the foundational text of the Renaissance emblem tradition.

Edition name: Electronic Variorum Edition of the Quixote
Content Description: A digital variorum edition of Don Quixote, allowing users to compare the text of the first editions with subsequent significant printings.
A critical edition of non-liturgical Latin songs from late antiquity and the early Middle Ages, focusing on the interplay between text and music.
A project presenting the Hebrew manuscripts of the Book of Ben Sira (Ecclesiasticus) found in the Cairo Genizah and Masada, alongside translations.

Edition name: Christine de Pizan: The Making of the Queen's Manuscript
Content Description: A digital facsimile and analysis of Harley MS 4431, the collected works of Christine de Pizan presented to Queen Isabeau of Bavaria.

Edition name: Corpus of the Inscriptions of Campā (CIC)
Content Description: A collection of Sanskrit and vernacular inscriptions from the ancient Kingdom of Champa (modern Vietnam), documenting its political and religious history.
A digital library containing the complete works of Dante Alighieri in the original Italian, accompanied by search tools and critical apparatus.
The complete correspondence of Charles Darwin, providing essential context for the development of his theory of evolution and his scientific network.
A scholarly electronic edition of Daisne's magic realist novel, allowing for the comparison of different textual versions and manuscript stages.
A web-based edition of subversive poetry and political libels from the reigns of James I and Charles I, circulating in manuscript form.
High-quality, searchable digital texts of Shakespeare's plays and poems, edited by the Folger Shakespeare Library for scholars and the general public.
A comparative edition allowing users to view the 1818 and 1831 editions of Frankenstein alongside the original manuscript drafts.
A resource dedicated to the study of medieval biblical and legal glosses, providing digital editions of these complex, multi-layered texts.
A digital gateway to the complete works and correspondence of Heinrich Heine, integrating the secular historical-critical edition with digital tools.
The complete writings of the Norwegian playwright Henrik Ibsen, including plays, poems, letters, and non-fiction prose, with critical commentary.
A massive critical edition of Mark Twain's private papers, letters, and published works, offering unprecedented access to his writing process.
An electronic edition of a 15th-century humanist dialogue advocating for the restoration of the patriarchal see of Aquileia to Udine.
A digital edition of the Quest for the Holy Grail, part of the Lancelot-Grail cycle, focusing on the spiritual journey of Galahad.
A digital facsimile and transcription of the Auchinleck Manuscript, a key source for Middle English romances that likely influenced Chaucer.
A digital edition of the astrological medical records of two 17th-century practitioners, documenting thousands of consultations with ordinary people.

Edition name: The Confessions of Augustine: An Electronic Edition
Content Description: A hypertext edition of Augustine's spiritual autobiography, featuring the Latin text with links to commentary and biblical references.
An edition of the oldest surviving European "book," a papyrus roll containing an allegorical commentary on an Orphic poem.

Edition name: The Gospel according to St. John
Content Description: A critical editing project focused on the Greek manuscripts of the Gospel of John, aiming to reconstruct the text's transmission history.

Edition name: The Proceedings of the Old Bailey
Content Description: A fully searchable edition of the proceedings of London's central criminal court from 1674 to 1913, documenting the lives of non-elite citizens.
A scholarly online edition of the complete plays of Richard Brome, a 17th-century playwright and former servant of Ben Jonson.
The personal diaries of a 19th-century teenager traveling from Baghdad to Europe, offering a unique perspective on the Ottoman Empire.
A digital transcription of the diary kept by the philosopher William Godwin for 48 years, recording his reading, writing, and social interactions.

Edition name: The Augsburg Web Edition of Llull's Electoral Writings
Content Description: A digital edition of Llull's works on voting theory and electoral systems, texts that anticipate modern social choice theory by centuries.
A project to create a dynamic critical edition of the Mishnah, the first major written collection of the Jewish oral traditions (Oral Torah).
An electronic publication of the Pseudepigrapha, ancient Jewish and Christian religious texts that were not included in the biblical canon.
A high-resolution digital library of the Dead Sea Scrolls, allowing users to examine these ancient biblical and sectarian manuscripts in detail.

Edition name: Editions of the Registers of the counts of Holland 1299-1345
Content Description: A digital edition of the chancery registers of the Counts of Holland, providing crucial data on the administration of the medieval Low Countries.
An interactive digital version of the first edition of Don Quixote held by the National Library of Spain, enriched with multimedia content.

Edition name: The Journals of the Lewis and Clark Expedition
Content Description: The complete journals of the Corps of Discovery's expedition across the western United States, featuring their observations on geography, flora, and fauna.
A digital edition of the Old English translation of Boethius's Consolation of Philosophy, traditionally attributed to King Alfred the Great.
An edition of the intellectual notebooks of the Scottish philosopher and historian James Mill, revealing the sources and development of his thought.

Edition name: A trial electronic edition of the Preface to 'Ancrene Wisse'
Content Description: A pilot project presenting the preface of Ancrene Wisse, a guide for female anchorites, testing TEI markup for medieval manuscripts.
The digital version of the Novum Testamentum Graece, the standard scholarly edition of the Greek New Testament used by translators and theologians.
A hypertextual tool for studying Ariosto's Orlando Furioso, enabling the tracking of characters, themes, and narrative threads across the epic.
An interactive resource for studying the works of Virgil, particularly the Aeneid, with linked texts, commentaries, and translations.
A digital presentation of the unique manuscript of the Poema de mio Cid, the foundational text of Spanish literature, with audio and images.
A complete digital facsimile and transcription of a lavishly illuminated 12th-century bestiary, describing animals and their moral allegories.

Edition name: M. Valerii Martialis Epigrammaton Liber IV
Content Description: A critical digital edition of the fourth book of Martial's Epigrams, known for their wit, satire, and vivid depiction of Roman life.
A commentary and text of Ovid's first Heroide (Penelope to Ulysses), exploring the genre of the fictional poetic letter.
A digital edition of the elegies of Propertius, focusing on his complex love poetry and mythological allusions.
An edition of a short satirical poem often attributed to Sulpicia, complaining about the state of the age under Domitian.
A collection of the Latin poems of Claudian, the last major poet of the Western Roman Empire, including his political panegyrics.
An electronic text of Juvenal's Satires, the bitter and ironic poems that critique the corruption and vices of Roman society.
A massive collection of charters and diplomatic documents from medieval Lombardy, essential for the study of northern Italian history.

Edition name: Geoffrey Chaucer's Book of the Duchess: A Hypertext Edition
Content Description: A hypertext edition of Chaucer's earliest major poem, an elegy for Blanche of Lancaster, designed to explore its textual variants.
A digital corpus of Greek inscriptions found in the territory of modern Croatia, documenting the Greek presence on the Adriatic coast.
A calendar and edition of the Gascon Rolls, recording the English administration of the Duchy of Aquitaine (Gascony) from 1317 to 1468.
High-resolution images and transcripts of the Hengwrt manuscript of the Canterbury Tales, considered one of the most textually accurate early copies.
A complete critical edition of the musical works, letters, and diaries of the composer Carl Maria von Weber.
A multispectral imaging project recovering the faded text of Livingstone's field diary from 1871, written on newspaper scraps in berry juice.
A hypertext edition of the commentaries on Terence attributed to the grammarian Donatus, exploring the history of Latin scholarship.
A complete digital corpus of the inscriptions from the ancient city of Aphrodisias in Turkey, covering the Roman and Byzantine periods.
A comprehensive collection of Greek and Latin inscriptions from the Roman province of Cyrenaica (modern Libya).
A digital edition of the inscriptions from Roman Tripolitania (western Libya), updating the standard printed corpus with new finds.

Edition name: e-sequence: Digital Edition of the Saint Gall corpus of Sequences
Content Description: A critical edition of the sequences (liturgical chants) composed by the monk Notker of St. Gall, integrating text and music.
An edition of the Latin poetry collection Sylva Poetica by the 17th-century English poet Phineas Fletcher.

Edition name: The Latin Prose and Poetry of Joseph Addison
Content Description: A collection of the Latin writings of the essayist Joseph Addison, showcasing his classical learning and poetic skill.

Edition name: History in the Making: Flaubert's L'Education Sentimentale
Content Description: A genetic edition of a specific chapter of L'Éducation sentimentale, visualizing the complex drafting process of Flaubert's manuscript.

Edition name: An electronic corpus of 15th century Castillian canconiero manuscripts
Content Description: A digital archive of the cancioneros, the songbooks that preserved the courtly lyric poetry of 15th-century Castile.

Edition name: Galenus' commentary on Hippocrates' "On the articulations"
Content Description: An edition of the Arabic translation of Galen's commentary on Hippocrates' treatise on joints, critical for the history of medicine.

Edition name: Edition der falschen Kapitularien des Benedictus Levita
Content Description: A scholarly edition of the False Capitularies, a famous 9th-century forgery of church law attributed to a fictitious deacon named Benedict.

Edition name: The Royal Inscriptions of the Neo-Assyrian Period
Content Description: A standardized online corpus of the royal inscriptions of the Neo-Assyrian kings, recording their military campaigns and building projects.
A digital facsimile and transcription of the unique manuscript of The Book of Margery Kempe, the earliest autobiography in English.
An edition of Ockham's Dialogus, a major treatise on heresy, papal power, and the rights of subjects vs. rulers.
A digital database of the Domesday Book, the great survey of England commissioned by William the Conqueror in 1086.
A digital resource uniting all the diverse first impressions of Chopin's music from his original French, German, and English publishers.
A digital reunification of all surviving fiction manuscripts of Jane Austen, allowing study of her drafting and editing process.
An exhaustive archive of Whitman's work, including all editions of Leaves of Grass, manuscripts, notebooks, and correspondence.
An edition of the personal papers, diaries, and lesson books of the influential music theorist Heinrich Schenker.
A tool for comparing the various early printed sources of Chopin's music to analyze textual discrepancies and evolutionary changes.

Edition name: John Foxe's The Acts and Monuments Online
Content Description: A digital edition of the four massive unabridged editions of Foxe's "Book of Martyrs" published during his lifetime.
A hypertext edition of Petrarch's Canzoniere (Rerum vulgarium fragmenta), exploring the structure and imagery of his sonnet sequence.
A digital text of the 900 Theses proposing a universal syncretism of philosophy and religion, for which Pico was accused of heresy.
A comprehensive project dedicated to the Decameron, featuring the text, translations, historical context, and critical essays.

Edition name: Pico della Mirandola: De hominis dignitate
Content Description: An edition of the Oration on the Dignity of Man, the famous "manifesto of the Renaissance" defending human free will and potential.
A database of inscriptions from the region of Israel/Palestine dating from the Persian period to the Islamic conquest, in multiple languages.
A comprehensive electronic edition of the medieval Grail romance Parzival, presenting facsimiles and transcriptions of all major manuscripts.
A hypertextual edition of the Decameron focusing on the intertextual and structural relationships within the narrative collection.

Edition name: Percy Bysshe Shelley: The Devil's Walk
Content Description: An edition of Shelley's broadside ballad "The Devil's Walk," a satire on the British government and social conditions.
A digital edition of the 1773 collection of poems that launched the career of the influential writer and dissenter Anna Laetitia Barbauld.
The collected correspondence of the "peasant poet" Robert Bloomfield, shedding light on working-class literary life in the Romantic era.
An archive digitizing the manuscripts of Percy Bysshe Shelley, Mary Shelley, William Godwin, and Mary Wollstonecraft.

Edition name: Thomas Lovell Beddoes: The Brides' Tragedy
Content Description: An edition of Beddoes' macabre and Jacobean-influenced tragedy, exploring themes of love, murder, and the supernatural.
A digital edition of Froissart's Chronicles, a major source for the Hundred Years' War, presenting the text alongside manuscript illuminations.
A corpus of Middle Welsh prose texts, providing a basis for linguistic analysis and the study of Welsh narrative tradition.
A complete online edition of Newton's writings, including his scientific masterpieces as well as his extensive theological and alchemical papers.
A digital facsimile and edition of the Vercelli Book, one of the four major poetic codices of Old English literature.
A project analyzing the manuscript tradition of Dante's Vita Nova, his prosimetrum about his love for Beatrice.
A specialized resource focusing on the text of Frankenstein, offering widely accessible versions and scholarly contexts.
A digital museum and library dedicated to the life and work of David Livingstone, featuring his field diaries, letters, and maps.

Edition name: Edizione Critica Ipertestuale dello Zibaldone Laurenziano
Content Description: A critical hypertext edition of the Zibaldone Laurenziano, Boccaccio's personal autograph notebook containing literary and student texts.

Edition name: A Social Edition of the Devonshire MS
Content Description: An edition of a verse miscellany compiled by women at the court of Anne Boleyn, annotated through a process of "social" community editing.
A digital library providing facsimiles of French Renaissance books and manuscripts, focusing on the spread of humanism.
A digital presentation of one of the few surviving pre-Columbian Maya books, detailing zodiacal constellations and calendar cycles.
The only known First Fleet convict narrative, recounting James Martin's escape from Botany Bay and arduous open-boat journey to Timor.
A database of French royal acts and charters from the Middle Ages, serving as a primary source for legal and political history.
An electronic archive of volumes of American poetry prior to 1920, searchable by full text.

Edition name: Bernard Muir's CD-ROM facsimile of Bodleian Library MS Junius 11
Content Description: A digital facsimile of the Junius 11 manuscript, the "Caedmon manuscript," containing Old English biblical poetry like Genesis and Exodus.
An enriched digital edition of Voltaire's Candide, featuring the text alongside manuscript variants, illustrations, and commentary.
A digital edition of the chronicle kept by Jewish inhabitants of the Łódź Ghetto, recording the daily struggle for survival under Nazi occupation.
An electronic edition of the first novel published by an African American, exploring the tragic lives of the mixed-race daughters of Thomas Jefferson.

Edition name: DASI: Digital Archive for the Study of Pre-Islamic Arabian Inscriptions
Content Description: An archive of inscriptions from pre-Islamic Arabia, documenting the languages and cultures of the peninsula before the rise of Islam.
The massive business and personal correspondence of the "Merchant of Prato," offering vivid details of 14th-century trade and daily life.
A digital presentation of the Shikshapatri, a key scripture of the Swaminarayan sect of Hinduism, outlining a code of conduct for devotees.
A celebrated digital edition of the Beowulf manuscript, providing high-resolution images, transcripts, and tools for paleo-graphical study.
An open-access collection of high-resolution images of Emily Dickinson’s surviving manuscripts, allowing readers to see her unique visual poetics.
A digital edition of Dickinson's letters, treating them as literary texts in their own right and revealing her intense personal relationships.
An edition of Gabriel Harvey's annotated copy of Livy's History of Rome, a prime example of how Renaissance readers engaged with classical texts.
A digital reconstruction of Galileo's manuscript notes on motion, documenting the experiments that led to his laws of falling bodies.
An edition of the "Kundige Bok," the statute book of the city of Göttingen, recording medieval municipal laws and regulations.
A fluid-text edition of Melville's first novel, Typee, showing the revisions made to the manuscript and the differences between early editions.
A multilingual digital edition of the correspondence of Mozart and his family, providing insight into his life, travels, and musical career.
A digital transcription and edition of Intibah (Awakening), considered the first literary novel of the Ottoman Tanzimat period.
A digital presentation of the famous 8,000-word letter dictated by the outlaw Ned Kelly, justifying his actions and criticizing police corruption.
An online edition of Argenis, a highly influential 17th-century political romance written in Latin that was read across Europe.
The diary of a precocious young Englishwoman who died of consumption at 19, recording her intellectual development and natural history observations.
A digital archive of the works of Isidore Ducasse (Lautréamont), the precursor to Surrealism known for Les Chants de Maldoror.

Edition name: Le Cartulaire de la seigneurie de Nesle
Content Description: An edition of the cartulary of the Lordship of Nesle, preserving charters and documents related to the administration of this French fiefdom.
The diary of a Maine midwife from 1785-1812, recording thousands of births and providing a detailed account of the domestic economy of the time.
The collected letters of the South African writer and feminist Olive Schreiner, author of The Story of an African Farm.

Edition name: Online Electronic Variorum of the Works of Rabindranath Tagore
Content Description: A variorum edition of the works of the Nobel laureate Tagore, allowing for the comparison of different versions of his poems and songs.
An edition of the ordinances regulating the French King's household (Hôtel du Roi), detailing court hierarchy, etiquette, and logistics.
A project providing the text of the Septuagint (the Greek Old Testament) alongside translations and textual tools.
An archive preserving audio recordings and manuscripts of the Sirat Bani Hilal, a massive Arabic oral epic poem about the migration of the Bedouin tribe.
The complete works and journals of the Danish philosopher Søren Kierkegaard, presented in a sophisticated digital environment.

Edition name: Stijn Streuvels: De teleurgang van den Waterhoek (The decline of the Waterhoek) CDROM
Content Description: A genetic edition of Streuvels' novel, documenting the text's evolution from manuscript drafts to the final published version.
A digital edition of the diaries, letters, and papers of the Adams family, including John, Abigail, and John Quincy Adams.
An edition of the account books of the Irish College at the University of Alcalá, documenting the daily life of the Irish diaspora in Spain.
A project focusing on the genetic editing of the works of André Gide, specifically Les Faux-Monnayeurs and his journals.
The diary of a Massachusetts Loyalist who was exiled to Canada after the American Revolution, recording his struggles and observations.
A collection of letters from a prominent English banking family, offering insights into Victorian social life, religion, and business.
A digital facsimile of a 15th-century psalter from Aberdeen, notable for its Scottish provenance and illumination.
A long-running project aiming to transcribe and collate all surviving 15th-century manuscripts of Chaucer's Canterbury Tales.

Edition name: The Digital Temple: A Documentary Edition of George Herbert's English Verse
Content Description: A digital edition of Herbert's The Temple, presenting the text alongside images of the earliest manuscripts and printed editions.
A digital presentation of the scrapbooks created by the artistic Diriks family, documenting Norwegian cultural life in the 19th century.

Edition name: The Documentary History of the Ratification of the Constitution
Content Description: A massive collection of documents recording the state-by-state debates and ratification process of the U.S. Constitution.
The complete correspondence of the First Lady Dolley Madison, documenting her central role in the social and political life of Washington D.C.
A digital presentation of a large, illuminated two-volume gradual from Nuremberg, famous for its whimsical marginal illustrations (including geese).
The massive archive of Samuel Hartlib, a 17th-century polymath whose correspondence network was a precursor to the Royal Society.
The complete collected letters of the poet Christina Rossetti, illuminating her literary career, faith, and relationships with the Pre-Raphaelites.
A comprehensive edition of the letters of the poet and critic Matthew Arnold, covering his views on education, culture, and society.
An electronic edition of Le Morte Darthur, focusing on the Winchester Manuscript and its relationship to Caxton's print edition.
The collected writings and correspondence of the Founding Father Alexander Hamilton, covering his military, legal, and political career.

Edition name: The Papers of Eliza Lucas Pinckney and Harriot Pinckney Horry
Content Description: The papers of two prominent South Carolinian women, documenting plantation management, botany, and social life in the 18th century.
The comprehensive edition of the diaries, letters, and military orders of George Washington.
The collected papers of the fourth U.S. President, covering his role in drafting the Constitution and his presidency.
The definitive edition of the extensive writings of Thomas Jefferson, spanning his entire public and private life.
A project creating digital scholarly editions of the novels of Pérez Galdós, beginning with Torquemada en la hoguera.
An edition of a 10th-century lament for the assassinated Duke of Normandy, William Longsword, a key text for Norman history.
A project dedicated to Leopardi's Zibaldone, his massive intellectual diary containing thoughts on philosophy, philology, and literature.
The war diary of the Flemish author Virginie Loveling, offering a civilian's perspective on the German occupation of Belgium during WWI.
An edition of the works of William Golder, one of New Zealand's earliest settler poets.
An electronic edition of the alliterative romance William of Palerne, a tale of a prince turned into a werewolf.

Edition name: Wittgensteins Nachlass: The Bergen Electronic Edition
Content Description: A complete transcription and facsimile of Wittgenstein's Nachlass (literary estate), essential for studying the development of his philosophy.
A comparative study of Leopardi's Zibaldone within the context of European culture and thought.
An edition of a rhymed inventory describing the art collection of the Mellini family in Rome, a valuable source for provenance research.
A database of inscriptions found in "friendship albums" (alba amicorum), documenting social networks and travel in early modern Europe.

Edition name: George Etheridge's Encomium on Henry VIII addressed to Elizabeth II, British Library Royal MS 16 C X
Content Description: A digital edition of a Greek encomium praising Henry VIII, presented to Queen Elizabeth I by the Regius Professor of Greek at Oxford.

Edition name: Digitalisierte Edition des Ältesten Appenzeller Landbuchs
Content Description: An edition of the oldest "Landbuch" (code of law) of the canton of Appenzell, a key document for Swiss legal tradition.

Edition name: Corpus of Ioannes Dantiscus' Texts & Correspondence
Content Description: The collected texts and correspondence of the Polish diplomat and poet Johannes Dantiscus, a central figure in Northern Humanism.
A digital edition of the Divine Comedy focusing on the text's manuscript tradition and variant readings.

Edition name: A London Provisioner's Chronicle, 1550–1563, by Henry Machyn: Manuscript, Transcription, and Modernization
Content Description: The diary of a London merchant undertaker, providing a vivid account of funerals, pageants, and executions in Tudor London.
A massive digital repository of historical legal sources from Switzerland, dating from the Middle Ages to the early modern period.

Edition name: El Cancionero digital de Gómez Manrique (páginas 11-44)
Content Description: A digital edition of the cancionero of the 15th-century poet Gómez Manrique, uncle of Jorge Manrique.
A database and edition of Anglo-Saxon charters, the legal documents recording land grants and privileges in early medieval England.

Edition name: Excerpts from the Chronicle of Matthew of Edessa
Content Description: An edition of sections from the chronicle of Matthew of Edessa, a primary source for the history of the Crusades and the Near East.
The lecture notes of the architect Antoine Desgodets, who taught at the Royal Academy of Architecture in Paris.

Edition name: Digitale Edition und Kommentierung der Tagebücher des Fürsten Christian II. von Anhalt-Bernburg
Content Description: The extensive diaries of a German prince during the Thirty Years' War, documenting court life, politics, and military events.

Edition name: Die Relatio Adelberts von Heidenheim und der Text Ilsungs
Content Description: An edition of a 12th-century report on the miracles of St. Walpurga, shedding light on medieval monasticism and saint cults.
An archive of the "Je chante ung chant" corpus of medieval songs, exploring the transmission of polyphonic music.
A comprehensive digital archive of Einstein's scientific and non-scientific manuscripts, including the papers on Relativity.
A digital edition of the Liber Iurium of the Bishop of Luni, a 13th-century manuscript recording the bishopric's rights and properties.
A scholarly platform dedicated to To the Lighthouse, featuring the manuscript, typescripts, proofs, and first edition of the novel.
A complete transcription of the thousands of manuscript pages of Madame Bovary, allowing readers to trace the novel's genesis.

Edition name: Digital Schomburg Editions: African American Women Writers of the 19th century
Content Description: A collection of 19th-century fiction, poetry, and biography by Black women, including Phillis Wheatley and Frances Ellen Watkins Harper.
A comprehensive historical-critical edition of Goethe's Faust, presenting all manuscript witnesses and printed versions.
A genetic edition of the notebooks of the novelist Theodor Fontane, containing sketches, drafts, and observations used in his fiction.

Edition name: Johann Christian Senckenberg: Digital Edition of the Diaries
Content Description: The diaries of the Frankfurt physician and naturalist Senckenberg, providing a detailed record of 18th-century medical practice and daily life.
An edition of the newspapers founded and edited by Dumas, revealing his prolific output as a journalist and commentator.
A large-scale project digitizing the vast correspondence of the explorer and scientist Alexander von Humboldt.
A critical edition of the works and letters of the Swiss historian Jacob Burckhardt, founder of cultural history and author of The Civilization of the Renaissance in Italy.
A bilingual digital source edition documenting the history of Jews in Germany from the early modern period to the present.
A digital collection of the surviving fragments of Sappho's poetry, often including the original Greek and translations.

Edition name: L’Orlando Furioso e la sua traduzione in immagini
Content Description: A project exploring the visual reception of Orlando Furioso, archiving the illustrations and paintings inspired by the epic over centuries.

Edition name: Schopenhauer’s Library: Annotations and marks in his Spanish books
Content Description: An analysis of the marginalia and annotations Schopenhauer made in the Spanish books in his personal library.
A portal dedicated to the Jesuit mathematician Clavius, key architect of the Gregorian calendar, featuring his correspondence and works.
The diaries of the composer and professor Aloys Fleischmann, documenting the cultural and musical life of Cork and Ireland in the 20th century.
A massive, disciplined corpus of German texts from 1600 to 1900, providing a foundation for linguistic and literary research.

Edition name: Project Tarsian: First Corinthians in Vaticanus Arabicus 13
Content Description: An edition of an Arabic manuscript of 1 Corinthians, exploring the textual history of the Bible in the Arabic-speaking world.
A crowd-sourced digital archive of letters written in or to Ireland during the tumultuous year of 1916, covering the Easter Rising and WWI.
A database of ancient legal texts, primarily Roman, serving as a resource for legal historians.
An edition of the popular ballad "The Wandering Jew's Chronicle," tracing the history of this legend in print culture.
The standard corpus of Roman inscriptions found in Britain, digitized and searchable by location, type, and material.

Edition name: Teutsche Academie der Bau-, Bild- und Mahlerey-Künste, Joachim von Sandrart, Nürnberg 1675/1679/1680: Wissenschaftlich kommentierte Online-Edition
Content Description: A critical online edition of Sandrart's Teutsche Academie, a monumental 17th-century history of art and artists comparable to Vasari.
A digital corpus of religious and secular texts from the Austrian Baroque period, designed for linguistic and literary analysis.

Edition name: Darwin Online: Online Variorum of Darwin’s Origin of Species
Content Description: A tool allowing line-by-line comparison of the six editions of On the Origin of Species published during Darwin's lifetime.

Edition name: Dāmos Database of Mycenaean at Oslo
Content Description: A searchable database of annotated Linear B texts, aiding the linguistic study of the earliest attested form of Greek.
The correspondence of the editors and contributors to Van Nu en Straks, the leading journal of the Flemish literary revival.
The correspondence between the author Stijn Streuvels and his publishers, illuminating the business of literature in the 20th century.
The correspondence between the Germanists August Sauer and Bernhard Seuffert, discussing the establishment of German philology as a discipline.
An edition of a 9th-century grammatical treatise by Ursus of Benevento, significant for the study of medieval education in southern Italy.
An archive documenting the life and career of "Buffalo Bill" Cody, exploring his role in shaping the myth of the American West.
A critical edition of the treatises of the 15th-century music theorist Tinctoris, covering counterpoint, modes, and notation.
A digital project focused on the Deipnosophists of Athenaeus, a massive compilation of ancient knowledge, quotations, and dining culture.

Edition name: Magistri Guillelmi Autissiodorensis Summa de officiis ecclesiasticis
Content Description: An edition of William of Auxerre's Summa on ecclesiastical offices, a key text for understanding medieval liturgy and sacramental theology.
A digital edition of the works of Robert Musil, including the massive, unfinished novel The Man Without Qualities.

Edition name: A Comprehensive Edition of Tocharian Manuscripts
Content Description: A project digitizing and editing manuscripts in the extinct Tocharian languages found on the Silk Road, crucial for Indo-European linguistics.

Edition name: Briefe und Texte aus dem Intellektuellen Berlin um 1800
Content Description: A collection of letters and texts from the vibrant intellectual circles of Berlin around 1800, featuring figures like Tieck and Chamisso.
A library of philosophical and theological texts produced in New Spain (Mexico) during the colonial period.
The correspondence between Robert Woods Bliss and Royall Tyler, offering insights into 20th-century diplomacy and art collecting.
The central digital edition of Humboldt's travel journals and writings, documenting his expeditions to the Americas.
The letters of the famous Florentine bookseller and biographer, a central node in the network of 15th-century humanists.

Edition name: Digitale Edition der Briefe Erdmuthe Benignas von Reuß-Ebersdorf (1670-1732)
Content Description: The correspondence of a noblewoman active in the Pietist movement, revealing the role of women in 18th-century religious networks.
The collected papers of the social reformer and Nobel Peace Prize winner Jane Addams, covering Hull House and the peace movement.
A digital edition of Pascal's Pensées, allowing users to reconstruct the fragmentary apologetic notes in various orders.

Edition name: Ödön von Horváth: Historisch-kritische Ausgabe – Digitale Edition
Content Description: A critical edition of the plays and prose of Horváth, a key figure in 20th-century German-language literature known for his "Volksstücke."
An edition of the Planctus attributed to Anselm, a text expressing deep sorrow and penitence often used in medieval devotion.
A genetic criticism project analyzing Beethoven's sketching and composition process through his manuscripts and sketchbooks.
A comprehensive archive of the works of Charles Harpur, the first major poet of European settlement in Australia.
A digital critical edition of Lope de Vega's comedy La dama boba, focusing on the transmission of the text.

Edition name: En el ojo del huracán. Cartas de ultramar a España 1823
Content Description: A collection of letters sent from the Spanish colonies in the Americas to Spain during the turbulent year of 1823.
A critical edition of Kosztolányi's novel Édes Anna, a psychological study of a maid who murders her employers.
Another digital instance or module of the critical edition of Kosztolányi's Édes Anna.

Edition name: Kassák Lajos: The Horse Dies the Birds Fly Away / A ló meghal a madarak kirepülnek
Content Description: A digital edition of Kassák's constructivist masterpiece, a long poem recounting his travels across Europe.
A critical edition of Golden Kite, Kosztolányi's novel about the tragic downfall of a provincial schoolteacher.
A critical edition of the Esti Kornél stories, featuring Kosztolányi's famous alter ego in a series of loose, impressionistic sketches.
An edition of a late 16th-century manuscript containing Hungarian songs and historical texts.
A critical edition of The Village Notary, a satirical novel criticizing the feudal county administration in Hungary.

Edition name: József Attila összes tanulmánya és cikke
Content Description: The complete collected essays and articles of the poet Attila József, covering literature, aesthetics, and politics.

Edition name: József Attila összes tanulmánya és cikke. Szövegek 1930-1937
Content Description: A focused edition of Attila József's prose writings from the 1930s, his most mature and politically active period.
A digital edition of the Estoria de Espanna, the first history of Spain written in the Castilian vernacular, commissioned by Alfonso the Wise.
An edition of the 16th-century romance Árgirus, a popular fairy-tale narrative in verse about a prince and a fairy.
The complete works of the soldier-poet Wathay, written during his captivity by the Ottomans, featuring songs and autobiographical verse.

Edition name: Adriai tengernek syrénája, gróf Zrínyi Miklós
Content Description: An edition of Zrínyi's epic poem The Siege of Sziget, the cornerstone of Hungarian Baroque literature.
A collection of the fragmentary verses of Rimay, a disciple of Balassi and a key figure in late Renaissance Hungarian poetry.
An edition of Rimay's early poetry collection, showing his development as a mannerist poet.
An edition of a 16th-century Hungarian prose romance.
A major 16th-century manuscript containing the largest collection of legends and sermons in medieval Hungarian.

Edition name: Régi Magyar Exemplumadatbázis/ Database of Old Hungarian Exempla
Content Description: A database of exempla (moral anecdotes) found in old Hungarian literature, used by preachers to illustrate their sermons.
The complete works of Kazinczy, the organizer of the Hungarian language reform and literary life in the early 19th century.
The complete works of the major poet of the Hungarian Enlightenment, known for his diversity of styles from Rococo to folk.

Edition name: Opera Aesthetica Szerdahelyana / Szerdahely György Alajos esztétikai írásai
Content Description: An edition of the aesthetic writings of Szerdahely, a Jesuit scholar who introduced the discipline of aesthetics to Hungary.
The collected works of a minor but representative poet of the Hungarian Enlightenment period.
The correspondence of Berzsenyi, the "hermit of Nikla," documenting his intellectual isolation and exchanges with Kazinczy.
A collection of correspondence between various Hungarian writers of the 18th and 19th centuries.
The correspondence of the Ráday family, prominent Protestant aristocrats and patrons of culture in 18th-century Hungary.
An edition of the Legend of Saint Margaret, a key text of medieval Hungarian monastic literature about the princess-nun Margaret.
A digital edition of the literary journal Orpheus, edited by Ferenc Kazinczy in 1790.
An edition of Magyar Museum, the first significant Hungarian-language literary journal, founded by Kazinczy, Batsányi, and Baróti Szabó.

Edition name: DER STURM. Digitale Quellenedition zur Geschichte der internationalen Avantgarde
Content Description: A digital edition of sources related to Der Sturm, the influential Berlin art magazine and gallery that promoted Expressionism and the avant-garde.

Edition name: Balassi Bálint összes verse (hálózati kritikai kiadás: version 1.0 and 2.0)
Content Description: A critical edition of the complete poems of Balassi, the first major poet of Hungarian literature to write in the vernacular.
A collection of old Hungarian spiritual songs and hymns.

Edition name: Szabó Lőrinc: Föld, erdő, isten; Kalibán; Fény, fény, fény; A sátán műremekei; Te meg a világ; Különbéke; Harc az ünnepért; Régen és most
Content Description: Critical editions of several volumes of poetry by Lőrinc Szabó, a master of the sonnet and a major 20th-century translator.
A digital edition of A Tett (The Deed), the first Hungarian avant-garde journal, published by Kassák during WWI.
A volume of the critical edition of Mikszáth's works, likely containing short stories or journalistic pieces.
Another volume of the critical edition of Mikszáth's works.

Edition name: P.S. Post Scriptum: A Digital Archive of Ordinary Writing
Content Description: An archive of private letters written by ordinary people in Portugal and Spain from 1500 to 1900, often intercepted by the Inquisition.
The complete correspondence of the German writer Jean Paul, known for his humorous and digressive novels.
A digital edition of the Middle High German narrative poem Der arme Heinrich, about a leper knight redeemed by a maiden's sacrifice.
A critical edition comparing the first two parts of L'Astrée, the massive pastoral novel that influenced 17th-century French culture.
A corpus of German travel guidebooks (Baedeker) and travel writings from 1875 to 1914, analyzed for linguistic patterns.

Edition name: Mächtekongresse 1818–1822. Digitale Edition der Dokumente zu den Kongressen von Aachen (1818), Troppau (1820), Laibach (1821) und Verona (1822)
Content Description: A digital edition of the diplomatic documents from the Congresses of the Holy Alliance, regulating European politics after Napoleon.

Edition name: Tagebücher von Andreas Okopenko. Digitale Edition
Content Description: The diaries of the experimental Austrian writer Okopenko, covering the post-war period and the literary scene of the "Wiener Gruppe."

Edition name: Ulrich Richental die Chronik des Konzils von Konstanz
Content Description: An illustrated chronicle of the Council of Constance (1414-1418), providing a vivid eyewitness account of the ecclesiastical gathering.

Edition name: Franco-Hungarian literary relations in the 20th century
Content Description: A digital collection of documents tracing the reception and interaction between French and Hungarian literature in the 20th century.
A genetic critical edition of Schnitzler's works, starting with Lieutenant Gustl and Anatol, showing the development of the texts.
The correspondence of the "Magus of the North," a philosopher who influenced Herder and Goethe with his critique of pure reason.

Edition name: Grundtvigs Vaerker (The complete works of N.F.S. Grundtvig)
Content Description: The massive collected works of Grundtvig, the pastor, poet, and politician who fundamentally shaped modern Danish national identity.

Edition name: Die Korrespondenz von Leo von Thun-Hohenstein
Content Description: The correspondence of the Austrian minister who reformed the educational system after the 1848 revolutions.

Edition name: Inscriptions of Greek Cyrenaica - Greek Verse Inscriptions of Cyrenaica
Content Description: A specialized collection of poetic inscriptions found in Cyrenaica, offering a glimpse into the literary culture of the province.
A critical edition of the 12th-century universal chronicle written by the Archbishop Romuald II of Salerno.

Edition name: Samuel Hahnemann - Digitale kritische Edition - Krankenjournal DF5
Content Description: An edition of the case journals of the founder of homeopathy, documenting his patients' symptoms and treatments.

Edition name: Arthur Schnitzler – Briefwechsel mit Autorinnen und Autoren
Content Description: The correspondence between Schnitzler and fellow writers, revealing the literary networks of turn-of-the-century Vienna.
An edition of a recently discovered 16th-century manuscript containing the oldest known Basque pastoral romance and poetry.
The minutes of the Bavarian Council of State, documenting the political decision-making process in the Kingdom of Bavaria.

Edition name: The glosses to the first book of the Etymologiae of Isidore of Seville
Content Description: An edition of the early medieval glosses on Isidore's Etymologies, showing how this encyclopedic text was taught and understood.

Edition name: In Search of the Drowned: Testimonies and Testimonial Fragments of the Holocaust
Content Description: A project analyzing the testimonies of Holocaust survivors, focusing on the linguistic and narrative structures of trauma.

Edition name: Alexander von Humboldt: Sämtliche Schriften digital
Content Description: A complete digital edition of Humboldt's published writings, including his essays, articles, and major monographs.

Edition name: Mystische Bücher in der Bibliothek der Kartause Erfurt
Content Description: An exploration of the mystical texts held in the library of the Erfurt Charterhouse, a center of late medieval spirituality.
A digital edition of the notebooks of the Nobel Prize winner Peter Handke, which serve as the "ur-text" for his published works.

Edition name: Gottfried Semper. Critical and Commented Edition
Content Description: A critical edition of the writings of the architect Gottfried Semper, exploring his theories on style, materials, and evolution in art.
A complete corpus of inscriptions in the Raetic language, an ancient language of the Alps related to Etruscan.
An interactive etymological lexicon of the Lepontic language, the oldest attested Celtic language, found in Northern Italy.
A detailed chronology of Schnitzler's life based on his diaries and letters, allowing users to trace his movements day by day.

Edition name: Clara Katharina Pollaczek: Arthur Schnitzler und ich
Content Description: The memoirs of Schnitzler's partner in his later years, providing an intimate portrait of the author and their relationship.
A geospatial visualization of the places Schnitzler visited or lived in, linked to his diary entries and correspondence.
A database of the books Schnitzler read, reconstructed from his diary entries, revealing his intellectual influences.
A digital edition of Schnitzler's complete diaries from 1879 to 1931, a monumental document of Viennese cultural history.
An archive of the newspaper clippings collected by Schnitzler, documenting the critical reception of his works.
A prosopographical database of people mentioned in the various digital editions of Austrian modernism (Schnitzler, Kraus, etc.).
The correspondence between the critic Hermann Bahr and Arthur Schnitzler, debating the literary trends of the fin de siècle.
An updated 2021 release of the IRT corpus, incorporating new technologies and scholarship on the inscriptions of Libya.
An edition of the Strategikon of Kekaumenos, an 11th-century advice book for Byzantine aristocrats on warfare and family life.
A repository of gnomologies (collections of wise sayings) and wisdom literature in Greek and Arabic, exploring their transmission.

Edition name: Die Urkunden und Akten des Klosters und des Oberamts Königsfelden
Content Description: A digital edition of the charters and administrative records of the Königsfelden Monastery, a Habsburg foundation.

Edition name: MEGAdigital – Online-Abteilung der historisch-kritischen Gesamtausgabe von Karl Marx und Friedrich Engels
Content Description: The digital component of the MEGA project, presenting the complete works and letters of Marx and Engels with critical apparatus.

Edition name: Auden Musulin Papers: A Digital Edition of W. H. Auden's Letters to Stella Musulin
Content Description: The correspondence between Auden and the writer Stella Musulin during his later years in Austria, revealing his domestic side.
An archive of critical editions of texts by the Church Fathers (e.g., Athanasius, Gregory of Nyssa), available for digital analysis.
A project digitizing early Arabic periodicals from the late 19th and early 20th centuries, a key source for the Nahda (Awakening).

Edition name: Korespondencja Jana Lechonia i Kazimierza Wierzyńskiego
Content Description: The correspondence between two major Polish poets of the Skamander group, documenting their exile in America.

Edition name: Korespondencja Mieczysława Grydzewskiego i Kazimierza i Haliny Wierzyńskich
Content Description: Letters exchanged between the editor of the influential London-based Polish journal Wiadomości and the poet Wierzyński.

Edition name: Die Ministerratsprotokolle Österreichs und der österreichisch-ungarischen Monarchie 1848–1918
Content Description: The minutes of the Council of Ministers of the Habsburg Monarchy, the central executive body of the Austrian Empire.

Edition name: Digital Scholarly Edition of Habsburg-Ottoman Diplomatic Sources 1500–1918
Content Description: A digital edition of sources documenting the diplomatic relations between the Habsburg Monarchy and the Ottoman Empire.

Edition name: Familiensache? Die Korrespondenz der Kaiserin Eleonora Magdalena
Content Description: The correspondence of the Holy Roman Empress Eleonora Magdalena, offering insight into dynastic politics and court life.

Edition name: Arthur Schnitzler: Mikroverfilmung des Cambridger Nachlasses
Content Description: A digital release of the microfilm archive of Schnitzler's literary estate held at Cambridge University.
A scholarly platform dedicated to Ernest Renan, the French philologist and historian known for his controversial Life of Jesus.
The diaries and correspondence of Mary Hamilton, a Bluestocking and courtier who knew Dr. Johnson and Horace Walpole.
The massive correspondence of the Zurich Reformer Heinrich Bullinger, a central figure in the European Reformation network.
The minutes of the meetings of the Austrian Academy of Sciences, documenting the development of research in Austria.
A critical edition of the writings of the influential music critic Eduard Hanslick, champion of absolute music and opponent of Wagner.
The diaries of the long-serving Austrian Trade Minister Josef Staribacher, known for his role in the "Kreisky Era."
